While it doesn't exactly show notifications status, it is re
cognizable that push notifications aren't being delivered. I
f you select "View Activity" for a participant, a large numb

WIP: Via "Button Pressed" sampling node. You can adjust labe
l and order (the order of the buttons on the home screen). T
he higher the order/weight, the deeper it sinks. Also, you c
an set it as a one-time button. And you can define groups fo
r buttons using             Button Group (on request). Group
s can be minimized.

Called "Incomplete" or "Timed out". Via "Timeout Interval" p
roperty of Form sample node (after how many seconds of inact
ivity a timeout warning will be shown). You can set it for e
ach form TL. Also, you can set length of the timeout alarm i
n seconds for each form TL. The alarm will trigger whether t
he form is open or not.

Feature Name:
Time-based Activity Triggering - Support for relative and ab
solute time
Unnamed: 11:
For the relative part (registration date only), you can use 
"Sampling Day" combined with other sampling nodes.

Feature Name:
Time-based Activity Triggering - Support for exact time vs. 
random within a time-window
Unnamed: 11:
For the random part, only the time (HH:mm) is supported. Thi
s event fires randomly a specified number of prompts in the 
specified time period and triggers the successor nodes. It a
lso supports a Minimum Time Between Prompts. And you can spe
cify the period using mutable values. The random time trigge
r follows a stratified randomization instead of allowing ran
dom prompts at any possible time. It takes the set time fram
e and divides it equally to accommodate the number of requir
ed prompts. It’s within these smaller chunks that the random
 prompt appears, only governed by the minimum time between p
rompts.

Feature Name:
Time-based Activity Triggering - Repeat logic (e.g. repeat d
aily, weekly, monthly, etc.)
Unnamed: 11:
They have these sampling nodes: Weekday, Date Range, Time Ra
nge, Initial (fires only once after the previous node is tru
e), Repeated (via defined interval and as long as the previo
us condition stays true

Feature Name:
Trigger activity based on time chosen by the participant (e.
g. using a previous calendar question)
Unnamed: 11:
Only on the time part (HH:mm) using "Time Range" sampling or
 "Participant Time Trigger" (on request, which allows you to
 repeat everday too) node.

Feature Name:
Trigger activity based on another event from the current par
ticipant (e.g. survey completed)
Unnamed: 11:
You can define Mutable Values after a form completion and us
e that value as a condition in triggering another form combi
ned with "Immediatly" sampling node. Also, you can use "Dela
y" sampling node to delay triggering the next form or action
.

Feature Name:
Trigger activity based on another event from another partici
pant
Create one-off sessions one at a time.

Unnamed: 11:
On request. Called "Nearby Devices Condition"; a sampling no
de. It uses IBeacon standard. Also, lets you specifiy Broadc
ast Signal (toggle), Scanning Interval, and Time Between Sca
ns.

On request. Via "Geofence Trigger" or "Multi Geofence Trigge
r". This event fires if a given geofence or any of the given
 geofences was entered/left or the participant is staying in
 it over some time. Other then the geofence itself, you can 
specify whether the geofence should trigger the initial loca
tion of the participant dependent on the geofence.

For sections/questions, it's called "Visibility Rule". For s
ampling, it's a Check Mutable Value (on request).

Feature Name:
Support for creating new variables and exporting them to be

You can create them via (I guess) "Mutable Value Editor" (on
 request) and "Change Mutable Value" sampling node dynamical
ly. Regarding the latter option, I'm not sure whether this m
eans question responses linked to mutable values will be aff
ected or not. You can set, increment, or decrement.
